tool_description:
Get there together! Shared car seats means a faster, greener and more affordable commute for you and your neighbors.
The Carma API provides complete access to developers to build carpool apps and solutions to help solve one of the world's most universal problems.
NB we have only included a small subset of the Carma APIs on mashape.com go to api.car.ma to see all of them.
name: Carma
title: Carma

api_list.name: Trip search
api_list.description: NB For the full Carma API listing go to https://api.car.ma/apidoc/ref/index.html. This retrieves a list of trips according to the parameters that were supplied. Note: This endpoint does NOT require authentication.

required_parameters.name: client_id
required_parameters.description: The oauth client id of the calling application. Clients should provide this otherwise they may be subject to much lower rate limits and may be blocked in future.

optional_parameters.name: originLon
optional_parameters.description: the longitude of the origin in decimal degrees between -180 and 180 (+ for E Long, - for W Long)

optional_parameters.name: originLat
optional_parameters.description: the latitude of the origin in decimal degrees between -90 and 90 (+ for N Lat, - for S Lat)

optional_parameters.name: destinationLon
optional_parameters.description: the longitude of the destination in decimal degrees between -180 and 180 (+ for E Long, - for W Long), null if destination should be ignored

optional_parameters.name: destinationLat
optional_parameters.description: the latitude of the destination, in decimal degrees between -90 and 90 (+ for N Lat, - for S Lat)

optional_parameters.name: pageNum
optional_parameters.description: Which page to return, 1-indexed. For example, page=2 with max=50 will get users 51-100.

optional_parameters.name: pageSize
optional_parameters.description: Number of results returned for each page

optional_parameters.name: userfields
optional_parameters.description: userFields 		A comma-separated list of fields that should be included with the user object. Clients SHOULD ask for the minimum amount of data they require. If this parameter is not included then the default is used. If this is passed in with an empty value as in ?userFields= then this will return just the user id and a flag indicating whether the user account has been deleted. The other supported values are: NAME, ALIAS, REGISTRATION_TIME, EMAIL,PHOTO_URL, HOME_CITY, COUNTRY, WEBPAGE, BIO, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION_ADDRESS, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION_ADDRESS_STREET, IS_CURRENTLY_RIDESHARING, LAST_TRIP_SEARCH, RATING, IS_FAVOURITE, IS_FREE_RIDER, IS_FREE_DRIVER, VALIDATIONS_EMAIL, VALIDATIONS_PHONE, VALIDATIONS_NUM_POSITIVE_REVIEWS, VALIDATIONS_CONNECTED_FACEBOOK, VALIDATIONS_AFFILIATES, LAST_SEEN_TIMESTAMP, LAST_LOGIN_TIMESTAMP, GENDER, CREDIT_BALANCES, LOCALE, TEST_ACCOUNT_STATUS, LAST_CHANGED_TIMESTAMP_BASIC, ACHIEVEMENTS, DISTANCE NOTE: The calling user can see all of their own details but will only see a subset of the public fields of another user

api_list.name: Nearby Users
api_list.description: NB For the full Carma API listing go to https://api.car.ma/apidoc/ref/index.html This retrieves a list of nearby users according to the parameters that were supplied. Note: This endpoint does NOT require authentication.

required_parameters.name: client_id
required_parameters.description: The oauth client id of the calling application. Clients should provide this otherwise they may be subject to much lower rate limits and may be blocked in future.

required_parameters.name: originlon
required_parameters.description: the longitude of the origin for the nearby users search in decimal degrees between -180 and 180 (+ for E Long, - for W Long)

required_parameters.name: originlat
required_parameters.description: The latitude of the origin of the nearby users search in decimal degrees between -90 and 90 (+ for N Lat, - for S Lat)

optional_parameters.name: pageNum
optional_parameters.description: Which page to return, 1-indexed. For example, page=2 with max=50 will get users 51-100.

optional_parameters.name: pageSize
optional_parameters.description: Number of results returned for each page.

optional_parameters.name: userFields
optional_parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields that should be included with the user object. Clients SHOULD ask for the minimum amount of data they require. If this parameter is not included then the default is used. If this is passed in with an empty value as in ?userFields= then this will return just the user id and a flag indicating whether the user account has been deleted. The other supported values are: NAME, ALIAS, REGISTRATION_TIME, EMAIL,PHOTO_URL, HOME_CITY, COUNTRY, WEBPAGE, BIO, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION_ADDRESS, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION_ADDRESS_STREET, IS_CURRENTLY_RIDESHARING, LAST_TRIP_SEARCH, RATING, IS_FAVOURITE, IS_FREE_RIDER, IS_FREE_DRIVER, VALIDATIONS_EMAIL, VALIDATIONS_PHONE, VALIDATIONS_NUM_POSITIVE_REVIEWS, VALIDATIONS_CONNECTED_FACEBOOK, VALIDATIONS_AFFILIATES, LAST_SEEN_TIMESTAMP, LAST_LOGIN_TIMESTAMP, GENDER, CREDIT_BALANCES, LOCALE, TEST_ACCOUNT_STATUS, LAST_CHANGED_TIMESTAMP_BASIC, ACHIEVEMENTS, DISTANCE NOTE: The calling user can see all of their own details but will only see a subset of the public fields of another user

optional_parameters.name: originlabel
optional_parameters.description: A user-provided label for the origin (e.g. an address).

optional_parameters.name: userid
optional_parameters.description: The id of the calling user (can be used if logged in to indicate the calling user such that their ride data is excluded from the results; can be SELF to indicate the caller, if authenticated)

optional_parameters.name: originradius
optional_parameters.description: The radius of the search from the origin in meters.

optional_parameters.name: orderbyonlinems
optional_parameters.description: If -1 then the results are ordered with the users nearest to the current or origin location first. 	 *            If not -1 this will group the results such that users who have been online since this number of milliseconds, followed by 	 *            the remaining users, within these groups the users are ordered by distance between their last location and the current location given 	 *            or the origin location given if the current location is not available.

optional_parameters.name: onlinesince
optional_parameters.description: Only return users that have been online since the specified time in millisecs from the epoch. -1 to disable.

optional_parameters.name: currentlon
optional_parameters.description: Optional current location used for contextualising addresses in decimal degrees between -180 and 180 (+ for E Long, - for W Long)

optional_parameters.name: currentlat
optional_parameters.description: Optional current location used for contextualising addresses in decimal degrees between -90 and 90 (+ for N Lat, - for S Lat)

api_list.name: Search Users By Alias
api_list.description: NB For the full Carma API listing go to https://api.car.ma/apidoc/ref/index.html Search users by name, the result will be ordered so users who's last known location is closest to the given location are first. Note: This endpoint does NOT require authentication

required_parameters.name: keyword
required_parameters.description: The search keyword. This can be a prefix of a users first name, or a first name and an initial of a surname. e.g. both Bob and Bobby S will match Bobby Sandz. More than 1 character of the surname will not be matched e.g. Bobby Sa will not match Bobby Sandz as surnames are private.

required_parameters.name: client_id
required_parameters.description: The oauth client id of the calling application. Clients should provide this otherwise they may be subject to much lower rate limits and may be blocked in future.

optional_parameters.name: userId
optional_parameters.description: The user id of the user doing the search, optional can be -1 for non logged in users

optional_parameters.name: lat
optional_parameters.description: The latitude of the given location in decimal degrees between -90 and 90 (+ for N Lat, - for S Lat), used to order users nearest to this location, optional

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: The longitude of the given location in decimal degrees between -180 and 180 (+ for E Long, - for W Long), used to order users nearest to this location, optional

optional_parameters.name: pageSize
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of users to return.

optional_parameters.name: pageNum
optional_parameters.description: Which page to return, 1-indexed. For example, page=2 with max=50 will get users 51-100.

optional_parameters.name: userfields
optional_parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields that should be included with the user object. Clients SHOULD ask for the minimum amount of data they require. If this parameter is not included then the default is used. If this is passed in with an empty value as in ?userFields= then this will return just the user id and a flag indicating whether the user account has been deleted. The other supported values are: NAME, ALIAS, REGISTRATION_TIME, EMAIL,PHOTO_URL, HOME_CITY, COUNTRY, WEBPAGE, BIO, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION_ADDRESS, LAST_KNOWN_LOCATION_ADDRESS_STREET, IS_CURRENTLY_RIDESHARING, LAST_TRIP_SEARCH, RATING, IS_FAVOURITE, IS_FREE_RIDER, IS_FREE_DRIVER, VALIDATIONS_EMAIL, VALIDATIONS_PHONE, VALIDATIONS_NUM_POSITIVE_REVIEWS, VALIDATIONS_CONNECTED_FACEBOOK, VALIDATIONS_AFFILIATES, LAST_SEEN_TIMESTAMP, LAST_LOGIN_TIMESTAMP, GENDER, CREDIT_BALANCES, LOCALE, TEST_ACCOUNT_STATUS, LAST_CHANGED_TIMESTAMP_BASIC, ACHIEVEMENTS, DISTANCE NOTE: The calling user can see all of their own details but will only see a subset of the public fields of another user
